title: Average Velocity Equation
text: If s(t) is the position of an object moving along a coordinate axis, the average velocity of the object over a time interval [a,t] is $$V_{avg}=\frac{s\left(t\right)-s\left(a\right)}{t-a}$$

title: Plugging In
text: In this question, $$t$$ goes from $$2$$ to $$2+h$$. Plug $$2+h$$ in $$t$$ and $$2$$ in a for the previous equation.
